newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee stronger on dollar and pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee stronger on dollar and pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee strengthened against both the dollar and the pound on Thursday, commercial forex dealers said.
The rupee traded at a mean rate of 20.3145 against the dollar from 20.4890 on Wednesday. Against the pound, the rupee was fixed at a mean of 33.5035 from 33.7920 on Wednesday.
Forex dealers said the rupee's strengthening versus the dollar was the combined result of trends in international markets and central bank's market interventions.
"The central bank sold dollars in the interbank market on Wednesday early afternoon and this morning. The intervention rates were a few cents below the interbank rate," one said.
The dealer said the central bank was sustaining the local currency because it was intervening when commercial banks were not asking for hard currency from the interbank market.

"Commercial banks have been square in their foreign exchange reserves for the past few days or so and they are not in a shortage situation. And yet the central bank is selling, probably to prevent any shortage situation."
